description.value: Measurement of hearing acuity using a calibrated hearing test device, and associated clinical interpretation.

purpose.value: To record measurements of hearing acuity using a calibrated hearing test device, and their interpretation by a clinician.

definition.value: Measurement of hearing acuity using a calibrated hearing test device, and associated clinical interpretation.
@ internal @
Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
Presentation of the air conduction test stimulus indirectly to the inner ear through the atmosphere, via the auditory canal and middle ear structures.
Presentation of the air conduction test stimulus indirectly to the inner ear through the atmosphere, via the auditory canal and middle ear structures.
Presentation of the bone conduction test stimulus directly to the inner ear via the cranial bones.
Presentation of the bone conduction test stimulus directly to the inner ear via the cranial bones.
The environment in which the audiometric test is administered.
The environment in which the audiometric test is administered.
The amount and nature of noise in the environment that may influence the test results.
The amount and nature of noise in the environment that may influence the test results.
Identification of the stimulus used in the hearing test to measure the hearing threshold.
Identification of the stimulus used in the hearing test to measure the hearing threshold.
Identification of parameters specifying a click stimulus.
Time over which the stimulus grows to full amplitude.
Time over which the stimulus grows to full amplitude.
Time over which the stimulus depletes to zero amplitude.
Time over which the stimulus depletes to zero amplitude.
Total duration of the click stimulus.
Total duration of the click stimulus.
Protocol used to measure the hearing threshold for pure tone, play and visual reinforcement orientation audiometry only.
Definition of the protocol used to define the threshold level used in the test.
Definition of the protocol used to define the threshold level used in the test.
The step size (in decibels) of the change in the stimulus intensity for threshold determination.
The step size (in decibels) of the change in the stimulus intensity for threshold determination.
The direction of change in the stimulus intensity.
The direction of change in the stimulus intensity.
Details of device used to conduct the test.
Details of the hearing device used.
Narrative description of the reliability of the test results.
Narrative description of the reliability of the test results.
Narrative description of any modfications to the standard methodology required to enable successful completion of the test.
Narrative description of any modfications to the standard methodology required to enable successful completion of the test.
Scale used for acoustic calibration of the test signal.
Scale used for acoustic calibration of the test signal.
The criteria on which the Pure Tone Average is calculated. The average is based on air conduction thresholds and masked thresholds replace unmasked thresholds when applying the formula.
The criteria on which the Pure Tone Average is calculated. The average is based on air conduction thresholds and masked thresholds replace unmasked thresholds when applying the formula.
The criteria on which the Pure Tone Average is calculated. The average is based on air conduction thresholds and masked thresholds replace unmasked thresholds when applying the formula.
The criteria on which asymmetry is defined in the test result interpretation.
The criteria on which asymmetry is defined in the test result interpretation.
Additional narrative about the protocol for the audiogram not captured in other fields.
Additional narrative about the protocol for the audiogram not captured in other fields.
@ internal @

Default, unspecified point in time which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time. For example, in a template, this event can be cloned and specifically identified to be the first and/or second test conducted as a part of a comprehensive assessment, such as a Hearing Conservation or Industrial Audiometric Assessment.
@ internal @
Identification of the Audiometry test performed.
Identification of the Audiometry test performed.
The test result measurements and interpretations which can be recorded per ear, or for both ears simultaneously.
Identification of the ear(s) to which the test stimulus is being presented.
Identification of the ear(s) to which the test stimulus is being presented.
The thresholds obtained using air conduction testing.

Record of the average measured results from more than one test. For example, the average of the 3000Hz to 6000Hz measurements in a Hearing Conservation or Industrial Audiometry Assessment. The data elements required in this use case may be quite limited and relevant ones revealed via templating.
